item.title: Sweep of Encampment at 19th and Welton Tuesday How Many Sweeps...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep of Encampment at 19th and Welton Tuesday
How Many Sweeps Does it For the City to Learn...

For the fourth week in a row, the City of Denver plans to SWEEP another encampment (this time 19th and Welton) to nowhere. Some residents of this camp at 19th and Welton shared with us today how they were kicked out of the Samaritan House Family shelter for having “stayed their time” and, after calling all other family shelters and signing up for section 8 lottery, they are now on ...the streets with no other options of where to go. (See interview here https://www.facebook.com/DenverHomelessOutLoud/videos/805786780232130)

Moving people who have nowhere to go with no answer does not work. It is time we start using our brains and our hearts, instead of continuing this shameful whack-a-mole.

Contact City Council to ask for support for our budget proposals for housing and sanitation resources. https://denverhomelessoutloud.org/…/denver-budget-proposal…/

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 19th and Welton and support residents of this encampment as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords/Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water
Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See MoreDenver Budget Proposals 2021 Sanitation Resources and Housing Proposals drafted by Denver Homeless Out Loud Sanitation Stations for Houseless Encampments: $700,000  This will pay for the follo…

item.title: More news... in Aurora...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

More news... in Aurora https://www.thedenverchannel.com/…/aurora-planning-to-lease…

The city of Aurora of is negotiating to lease a vacant warehouse to give people experiencing a homelessness a warm place to sleep during the winter months, Mayor Mike Coffman announced Tuesday.

thedenverchannel.com

Aurora planning to lease warehouse as temporary homeless shelter

The city of Aurora of is negotiating to lease a vacant warehouse to give people experiencing a homelessness a warm place to sleep during the winter months, Mayor Mike Coffman announced Tuesday.The city of Aurora of is negotiating to lease a vacant warehouse to give people experiencing a homelessness a warm place to sleep during the winter months, Mayor Mike Coffman announced Tuesday.

item.title: The City of Denver SWEEPS away approximately 40 people at 14th...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The City of Denver SWEEPS away approximately 40 people at 14th and Pennsylvania this morning. Once again, the City used fencing in order to prevent volunteers from assisting our unhoused community members. Fencing began early at 5:30am. DHOL staff, neighbors, outreach workers, advocates and press witnessed residents’ personal belongings being thrown away in a garbage truck. Today there were further prohibitions from the police on volunteers who were ready to assist our homele...ss community members with moving.
TOMORROW the City of Denver plans to SWEEP the following block. Please come and support our unhoused community members at 14th and Clarkson and support residents of these encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords/Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Day 2 of constant sweeps. None of these people are getting...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Day 2 of constant sweeps. None of these people are getting housed... they will just be a block or two away when this is done. Further compounding the problem. Sanctioned camps with some organization would be much better than this. How hard is it to say “line your tents up here in this park and that parking lot” etc, use these bathrooms and follow these simple rules?

Apparently impossible for our Mayor. Despite a lot of support and great designs for sanctioned camps and m...any service providers willing and prepared to provide for such needs our Mayor would rather bend to the will of rich developers and spend tax payer money scattering our homeless form one place to the next.

Do you ever wonder where our Mayor and city officials learn these techniques? You know they teach these kind of things at conferences sponsored by the real-estate lobby. Conferences city officials get invited to for free at fancy resort places, followed up by free tickets to box seats to various shows and sporting events. I doesn't all come from the same person but different folks from the real-estate lobby taking turns providing these things to council members and appointees of the Mayor. It

Ask this question of your city council member. Ask it of all the Mayors appointees staff chiefs etc. They are bought in this manner. It's all “nice and legal like” but still corrupt. And it leads to appointed public heath officials defying CDC guidelines. City attorney supporting unconstitutional Jim Crow style laws and more...

You know Covid is starting to spike again. It will be cold and flu season soon enough.

Are you happy to support the real-estate lobby's campaign contributions form these greedy developers. Remember this is public space they are influencing control over.
Not private space that they actually own. How long do you think it will take them to come exert control of private space that they do not own? Like yours. We are not far from it.

320,500 or so total housing in Denver. That s everything people who own houses, people paying mortgages, people paying rent, folks ins subsidized housing. It has been reported that we have 100K evictions pending in this city and 300K state wide. A large portion of that will likely be in the metro area. Think about it that is merely 1/3 of all the housing that could be empty if these evictions go through. Apparently collecting rent does not mean much to these property owners. In a city where 1/3 of the people have been evicted just where doe these people think that they will find renters?
https://www.facebook.com/217504118379549/videos/386836262476679

See MoreDenver Homeless Out Loud was live.

item.title: The City of Denver SWEEPS away approximately 60 people at 14th...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The City of Denver SWEEPS away approximately 60 people at 14th and Logan this morning.

Once again, the City used fencing in order to prevent volunteers from assisting our unhoused
community members. Fencing began early at 5:30am. DHOL staff, neighbors, outreach
workers, advocates and press witnessed at least 10 tents thrown away in a garbage truck with...
those residents’ personal belongings still inside of them. One couple left to get a cart for their
things and they were denied re-entry and all of their belongings were thrown away in a garbage
truck.
One resident and plaintiff in the lawsuit filed yesterday was arrested while clearly in distress
over having to move repeatedly.
TOMORROW the City of Denver plans to SWEEP the following block. Please come and support
our unhoused community members at 14 th and Pennsylvania and support residents of these
encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords/Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely
be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

item.title: Race and Homelessness Vigil 5256 Minutes for Every Black...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Race and Homelessness Vigil
5256 Minutes for Every Black Indigenous and Person of Color Who is Homeless in Denver

Starting on Wednesday October 14th at 7am we will be holding space in front of City Hall for 5256 minutes (equaling 89 hours) ending October 17th at 10pm. This is to honor and stand for every BIPOC who is homeless in Denver right now.

...Continue Reading
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: We know this story ... in the comments you will find how they...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We know this story ... in the comments you will find how they used the same technique to hide land under a community garden. I the case we will share in the comments that used to have public housing on it. With some patience exersized by the realestate lobby investors they managed to exchange it for 300K+$ condos.

Make you wonder what they are planning to build on this plot of land? We are thinking it will not be budget housing. In a city that 87% of the renters make 35K ...or less what kind of housing do you think they have plans to build on it? Since the city did not buy it there will not be public housing on it, since the linkage fee has no enforcement behind it there is likely not to be any affordable housing included in it... do you follow me?

Do you see how this works yet? If not expect your rent to double in 5 years. That is exactly half the time it took them to double your rent last time playing this game. A game where you lose and many wind up out on the streets

.https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-urban-gardens-el-oasi…/…

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-urban-gardens-el-oasi…/…

See MoreMembers of a Denver community garden that supplies local food banks fight to save it from developers.

denverpost.com

A plot of land given to Denver Urban Gardens for $1 to house a community garden will be sold to developers for $1.2 million
